str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From apo and krino; to conclude for oneself, i.e. to respond; by Hebraism to begin to speak.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A primary verb; to 'grave', especially to write; figuratively, to describe.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To live, be alive. A primary verb; to live.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
Bread, a loaf, food. From airo; bread or a loaf.
Only, solitary, desolate. Probably from meno; remaining, i.e. Sole or single; by implication, mere.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
From rheo; an utterance, ; by implication, a matter or topic; with a negative naught whatever.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Dative Neuter Singular
str2: From ek and poreuomai; to depart, be discharged, proceed, project.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
The mouth, speech, eloquence in speech, the point of a sword.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
